description: From Middle English careles, from Old English carlēas (“careless, reckless, void of care, free from care, free”), equivalent to care +‎ -less. Cognate with Icelandic kærulaus (“careless, negligent”).

adjectives.description: careless (comparative more careless, superlative most careless)

entries.meaning: Not giving sufficient attention or thought, especially concerning the avoidance of harm or mistakes. [from 16thc.]
examples: Jessica was so careless that she put her shorts on backwards.

entries.meaning: (archaic) Free from care; unworried, without anxiety. [from 11thc.]
examples: Good-humored, easy, and careless, he presided over his whale-boat as if the most deadly encounter were but a dinner, and his crew all invited guests.
